tit.j: 阪妻・立花・ユニヴァーサル連合映画

sen.j: 阪妻・立花・ユニヴァーサル聯合映画（ばんつま たちばな ユニヴァーサル れんごうえいが、1926年9月 契約 - 1927年5月 契約解除）は、かつて存在した日本とアメリカ合衆国との合弁による、日本の映画会社である。
sen.e: Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga (contract was concluded in September 1926, contract was terminated in May 1927) was an once-existed Japanese movie company that was jointly established by Japanese capital company and American capital company.

Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga was a Japanese film company that was jointly established between a Japanese company and an American company (its contract was signed in September of 1926 and terminated in May of 1927).
sen.cmt: moved description in parenthesis to the end; eliminated "once-existed"; eliminated "capital" in both cases; changed "movie company" to "film company"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga was a Japanese film company that was jointly established between a Japanese company and an American company (its contract was signed in September 1926 and terminated in May 1927).
sen.cmt: 月、年の間のofを除去しました。

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）9月、当時のスター俳優阪東妻三郎は、米国ユニバーサル映画社のために阪東妻三郎プロダクション（阪妻プロ）が映画製作を行なう旨の契約を同社と交わした。
sen.e: In September 1926, then star actor Tsumasaburo BANDO concluded the agreement with Universal Pictures Co., Ltd of U.S under which Bando Tsumasaburo Production (Bantsuma Puro) was to produce films for Universal.

In September of 1926, a star actor of the time named Tsumasaburo BANDO signed an agreement with Universal Pictures Co., Ltd of the U.S., under which Bando Tsumasaburo Productions (Bantsuma Puro) was to produce films for Universal.
sen.cmt: changed "concluded the agreement" to "signed an agreement"; Production→Productions; fixed grammar
sen.e: In September 1926, a star actor of the time named Tsumasaburo BANDO signed an agreement with Universal Pictures Co., Ltd of the U.S., under which Bando Tsumasaburo Productions (Bantsuma Puro) was to produce films for Universal.
sen.cmt: 月、年の間のofを除去しました。

sen.j: この契約は、米国公開のための契約ではなかった。
sen.e: The purpose of this agreement was not showing films in the U.S.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The purpose of the agreement did not involve showing films in the United States.
sen.cmt: changed "was not" to "did not involve"; changed "U.S" to "United States";
sen.e: The purpose of the agreement did not involve showing films in the United States.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国内での阪妻人気に注目したユニヴァーサル日本支社長が、自社作品の日本国内での併映に、と目論んだものである。
sen.e: The head of Universal's Japan office, who saw the advantage of Bantsuma' popularity in Japan, intended to show Universal's films together with the films of Bantsuma Puro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: By taking advantage of Bantsuma's popularity in Japan, the head of Univeral's Japan office intended to show films produced by Universal together with films produced by Bantsuma Puro.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: By taking advantage of Bantsuma's popularity in Japan, the head of Univeral's Japan office intended to show films produced by Universal together with films produced by Bantsuma Puro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: いっぽう、阪妻プロの経営者である一立商店の立花良介は、それに先行する1925年（大正14年）に同プロダクションを設立、奈良の中川紫郎が経営する中川紫郎プロダクション撮影所、東京の高松豊次郎が経営するタカマツ・アズマプロダクションの吾嬬撮影所などを使用していた。
sen.e: Ryosuke TACHIBANA of Ichiritsu Shoten, the chief executive of Bantsuma Puro who established it in 1925, used Shiro NAKAGAWA's "Nakagawa Shiro Production Studio" in Nara and Toyojiro TAKAMATSU's "Takamastu Azuma Production Azuma Studio" in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Ryosukue TACHIBANA of Ichiritsu Shoten, who established Bantsuma Puro in 1925 and became its chief executive officer, used Shiro NAKAGAWA's "Nakagawa Shiro Production Studio" in Nara, as well as Toyojiro TAKAMATSU's "Takamatsu Azuma Production Azuma Studio" in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence near the beginning to read more naturally; added comma after "Nara" and changed "and" to "as well as" in order to give a separation between the two places
sen.e: Ryosukue TACHIBANA of Ichiritsu Shoten, who established Bantsuma Puro in 1925 and became its chief executive officer, used Shiro NAKAGAWA's "Nakagawa Shiro Production Studio" in Nara, as well as Toyojiro TAKAMATSU's "Takamatsu Azuma Production, Azuma Studio" in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: Production,とAzumaの間に,を挿入しました。

sen.j: 翌1926年5月2日からは京都の太秦に開所した「太秦撮影所」を稼動し、阪東の主演作を製作していた。
sen.e: He then established "Uzumasa Studio" at Uzumasa, Kyoto and started to produce films starring Bando from May 2, 1926.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He then established "Uzumasa Studio" at Uzumasa, Kyoto and began producing films starring Bando on May 2, 1926.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: He then established 'Uzumasa Studio' at Uzumasa, Kyoto and began producing films starring Bando on May 2, 1926.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: この契約により、ユニヴァーサル社からは撮影・照明等の機材、現像機材、特殊撮影機材等、当時の金額で20万ドルに相当する供与を受け、また半年交代で3-4名の技術スタッフ派遣を受け、阪妻プロからは毎年男女優1名ずつをユニヴァーサル・シティ (カリフォルニア州)に派遣、見学および必要に応じては出演も可能、太秦撮影所製作の映画をユニヴァーサル社が世界配給も可能、という壮大な計画を立花は発表した。
sen.e: Under this agreement, according to Tachibana, Universal was obliged to provide equipment of filming/lighting, development equipment and special filming equipment, equivalent to two-hundred thousands dollars at the time, as well as to dispatch three to four technical staffers, while Bantsuma Puro obtained the right to dispatch an actor and an actress every year to Universal City (California), make them appear in films if necessary and distribute films produced at Uzumasa Studio through Universal.

Under this agreement, according to Tachibana, Universal was obliged to provide filming and lighting, development and special filming equipment equivalent to two-hundred thousand dollars at the time, as well as dispatch three to four technical staff members, while Bantsuma Puro obtained the right to dispatch an actor and an actress every year to Universal City (California), have them appear in films if necessary and distribute films produced at Uzumasa Studio through Universal.
sen.cmt: changed "filming/lighting" to "filming and lighting"; eliminated "equipment" after "lighting" and development"; thousands→thousand; changed "staffers" to "staff members"; changed "make them appear" to "have them appear";
sen.e: Under this agreement, according to Tachibana, Universal was obliged to provide filming and lighting, development and special filming equipment equivalent to two-hundred thousand dollars at the time, as well as dispatch three to four technical staff members, while Bantsuma Puro obtained the right to dispatch an actor and an actress every year to Universal City (California), have them appear in films if necessary and distribute films produced at Uzumasa Studio through Universal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 米国ユニヴァーサル社の創立社長カール・レムリも、日本映画の技術的向上を願うメッセージを日本の興行関係者に向けて送った。
sen.e: Carl Laemmle, the founder and the president of Universal, sent a message to Japan's movie-related people expressing his hope for the improvement of Japanese movie technology.
Carl Laemmle, the founder and president of Universal, sent a message to those involved in Japan's film-making business that expressed his hopes for the improvement of Japanese movie technology.
sen.cmt: changed "Japan's movie-related people" to "those involved in Japan's film-making business" and fixed grammar accordingly
sen.e: Carl Laemmle, the founder and president of Universal, sent a message to those involved in Japan's film-making business that expressed his hopes for the improvement of Japanese movie technology.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年10月4日には、早くも監督ジェイ・マーチャント、現像技師アルフレッド・ゴズディン、撮影技師ハロルド・スミス、電気技師（照明技師）アル・ボックマンとともに、ベルハウエルの映画用カメラ6台、野外用ゼネ（発電機）2台、照明機材80台などが横浜港に到着した。
sen.e: On October 4th of the same year, six movie cameras manufactured by Bell and Howell, two outdoor generators (generator) and 80 pieces of lighting equipment arrived at Yokohama Harbor, together with director Jay Marchant, development engineer Alfred Gosdin, filming engineer Harold Smith and electric engineer (lighting engineer) Al Bockman.

On October 4th of the same year, six movie cameras manufactured by Bell and Howell, two outdoor generators and eighty pieces of lighting equipment arrived at Yokohama Harbor together with director Jay Marchant, development engineer Alfred Gosdin, filming engineer Harold Smith and electrical engineer (lighting engineer) Al Bockman.
sen.cmt: eliminated (generator); changed "80" to "eighty"; eliminated comma after "Harbor"; changed "electric engineer" to "electrical engineer";
sen.e: On October 4th of the same year, six movie cameras manufactured by Bell and Howell, two outdoor generators and eighty pieces of lighting equipment arrived at Yokohama Harbor together with director Jay Marchant, development engineer Alfred Gosdin, filming engineer Harold Smith and electrical engineer (lighting engineer) Al Bockman.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またこの「連合映画」社の宣伝部長に、時事新報の記者でエスペランティストとしても知られる神崎泉（のちの女優桜緋紗子の父）が就任した。
sen.e: Izumi KANZAKI (father of actress Hisako SAKURA), a reporter of Jiji Shinpo who was also known as Esperantist, became the advertizing manager of "Rengo Eiga".
Izumi KANZAKI (father of actress Hisako SAKURA), a reporter of Jiji Shinpo who was also known as an Esperantist, became the advertising manager of "Rengo Eiga."
sen.cmt: added "an" before "Esperantist"; advertizing→advertising; moved period to before ending quotation
sen.e: Izumi KANZAKI (father of actress Hisako SAKURA), a reporter of Jiji Shinpo who was also known as an Esperantist, became the advertising manager of 'Rengo Eiga.'
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 設立第1作『切支丹お蝶』は翌1927年（昭和2年）1月28日に、ユニヴァーサル社配給のフランス映画『大帝の密使』（ヴィクトル・トゥールジャンスキー監督）とともに公開された。
sen.e: The company's first film "Kirishitan Ocho" was released on January 28, 1927 together with "Taitei no Misshi" (directed by Victor Tourjansky), a French film distributed by Universal.
The company's first film "Kirishitan Ocho" was released on January 28, 1927, together with "Taitei no Misshi" (directed by Victor Tourjansky), a French film distributed by Universal.
sen.cmt: added comma after "1927"
sen.e: The company's first film "Kirishitan Ocho" was released on January 28, 1927, together with "Taitei no Misshi" (directed by Victor Tourjansky), a French film distributed by Universal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『切支丹お蝶』は、山上紀夫監督をはじめとして、東邦映画製作所の解散によって流れてきた撮影技師高城泰策らスタッフ、女優五月信子、男優高橋義信らキャストと、ハロルド・スミス、アル・ボックマンの指導による撮影が行われた。
sen.e: "Kirishitan Ocho" was produced by such people as director Norio YAMADA, filming engineer Yasusaku TAKAJO and other staff who came from Toho Eiga Seisakusho, actress Nobuko SATSUKI and actor YOSHINOBU TAKAHASHI, and its filming was done under the guidance of Harold Smith and Al Bockman.

Involved in the production of "Kirishitan Ocho" was director Norio YAMADA, filming engineer Yasusaku TAKAJO and other staff from Toho Eiga Seisakusho, the actress Nobuko SATSUKI and actor YOSHINOBU TAKAHASHI, and its filming was done under the guidance of Harold Smith and Al Bockman.
sen.cmt: changed "produced by such people" to "Involved in the production", using it at the beginning of the sentence;
sen.e: Involved in the production of "Kirishitan Ocho" was director Norio YAMAGAMI, filming engineer Yasusaku TAKAJO and other staff from Toho Eiga Seisakusho, the actress Nobuko SATSUKI and actor YOSHINOBU TAKAHASHI, and its filming was done under the guidance of Harold Smith and Al Bockman.
sen.cmt: YAMADAをYAMAGAMIに変更しました。

sen.j: 同作は、日本の映画批評界の注目の的となり、絶賛を受けた。
sen.e: This film attracted the attention of Japanese film critics and was acclaimed.
The film attracted the attention of Japanese film critics and received rave reviews.
sen.cmt: changed "was acclaimed" to "received rave reviews" for "絶賛を受けた"
sen.e: The film attracted the attention of Japanese film critics and received rave reviews.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし「阪妻・立花・ユニヴァーサル連合映画」社の最大の欠点は、阪妻プロ第4作の『尊王』以降の契約を根拠に、阪東出演作の配給権は松竹が握っていたことである。
sen.e: However, the biggest defect of "Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga" was the fact that Shochiku held the distribution right of films in which Bando plays a leading character based on the contract that was applicable to the fourth film of Bantsuma Puro "Sonno" and subsequent films.

However, the greatest fault of "Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga" was the fact that Shochiku held the right to distribute films starring Bando, based on a contract that applied to the fourth film of Bantsuma Puro "Sonno" as well as subsequent films.
sen.cmt: changed "biggest defect" to "greatest fault"; added comma after "Bando"; fixed grammar
sen.e: However, the greatest fault of 'Bantsuma Tachibana Universal Rengo Eiga' was the fact that Shochiku held the right to distribute films starring Bando, based on a contract that applied to the fourth film of Bantsuma Puro "Sonno" as well as subsequent films.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: したがって、阪東は小沢得二監督の『嵐に立つ女』に顔を出した程度で、「連合映画」にはまったく出演できなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, Bando couldn't appear in the films of "Rengo Eiga", except "Arashi ni Tatsu Onna" directed by Tokuji OZAWA.
Therefore, Bando could not appear in "Rengo Eiga" films except for "Arashi ni Tatsu Onna," which was directed by Tokuji OZAWA.
sen.cmt: couldn't→could not; fixed grammar
sen.e: Therefore, Bando could not appear in 'Rengo Eiga' films except for "Arashi ni Tatsu Onna," which was directed by Tokuji OZAWA.

sen.j: スター不在の同社現代劇は興行力に欠け、またユニヴァーサル社の思惑からも外れた。
sen.e: The company's historical dramas without a star couldn't attract people and Universal's expectation was betrayed.

sen.e: The company's historical dramas without a star were unable to attract audiences, betraying Universal's expectations.

sen.j: 同年5月末には契約解除となり、訴訟にまで発展した。
sen.e: The agreement was terminated at the end of May of the year, and the disputes became a litigation.

sen.e: The agreement was terminated at the end of May of the same year and the disputes went all the way to litigation.

sen.j: 立花と阪東の描いた世界への夢は、夢のまま終わった。
sen.e: Dream of Tachibana and Bando to make inroads to the world market ended up a mere dream.
The dream of Tachibana and Bando to make inroads into the world market ended up as a mere dream.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar

sen.j: 「太秦撮影所現代劇部」は解散、『飛行夜叉』全3作は未完のまま、35本のサイレント映画を残した。
sen.e: "Contemporary Drama Division of Uzumasa Studio" was broken up, three films of "Hiko Yasha" remained imcompleted, and the company left 35 silent films.
The "Contemporary Drama Division of Uzumasa Studio" was dissolved, and the three films called "Hiko Yasha" were never completed and the company left behind thirty-five silent films.
